comments:
When using jar files from a Variable that was defined as a Folder the project 
build passes but when trying to run the application the jars are not added to 
the execution command only the folder's path does.
This results in the inablilty to run such projects.

Could you provide more detail, please? Are you trying to run a regular Java 
application or a plug-in? In case of a former, you should open a defect against 
JDT, not PDE.

Platform Win NT
Version 2.1 RC1
VM Sun 1.3.1

I believe that I am experiencing this problem as well.  I just upgraded from M5 
to RC1.  I have a project that includes numerous external jar files defined 
with a class path variable.  Browsing, and building resolve these jar files 
correctly.  However when I attempt to run the java application, the external 
jar entries are added to the classpath as the workspace directory.  As an 
example, I have a classpath variable called FRAMEWORK_HOME that points to the 
directory T:\.  I have 10 external jar files defined relative to this 
variable.  The following is the debug properties launch command:

D:\jdk1.3.1\bin\javaw.exe -Xmx256m -classpath 
T:\tnt\bin;T:\tnt\release\jars\ffnew.jar;d:\eclipsesave\workspace;d:\eclipsesave
\workspace;d:\eclipsesave\workspace;d:\eclipsesave\workspace;d:\eclipsesave\work
space;d:\eclipsesave\workspace;T:\tnt\release\jars\connectionServer.jar;d:\eclip
sesave\workspace;d:\eclipsesave\workspace;T:\tnt\release\jars\NullImpls.jar;T:\t
nt\release\jars\common.jar;d:\eclipsesave\workspace;d:\eclipsesave\workspace 
com.cboe.tnt.initialize.Tnt Tnt 
com.cboe.infrastructureServices.systemsManagementService.ConfigurationServiceFil
eImpl c:\\tnt\\FoundationFramework.properties

Every d:\eclispesave\workspace; entry should be one of the external jars.  The 
actual entry should be something like T:\ComonFacilities\release\Utility.jar.

I have tried using a launch config created with the M5 release and also after 
creating a brand new launch config in the RC1 release.

I upgraded to RC1 by extracting the RC1 zip file into a new directory.  I 
started eclipse with the -data parameter pointing to a workspace that had 
previously run under M5.
